confession.seduction_context: When angry with her husband who had scolded her ('tancée'); promised to give her money in abundance
sabbat_activities: beaten by Devil for refusing to carry out his will
refused to spoil crops due to dearth and hardship of poor
witnessed bourgeois women with silver belts arriving on sows or calves

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused her of stealing wood from his barn
his wife called Barbe 'vielle bigotte et genoche' (old bigot and fool)
he cut off overhanging branch of apple tree
accused her of causing a fog on the lake

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: Note from Didier Clement prévôt of Charmes that he has arrested Barbe. Informations preparatoires had already been taken against her. She had fled for 4-5 months after threats of arrest, just returned and was arrested.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: First interrogation. Gave biographical information and confessed to serving the Devil, seduced by maitre Percy 6 months before when angry with husband.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: Attempted to retract confessions but then reiterated them. Attempted suicide by hanging in prison from fear of torture. Changed seduction date to 12 years before. Confessed to killing two cows, attending sabbats, killing three horses in Vallois.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: PG des Vosges orders further questioning to establish details of crimes she has admitted.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: Repeated earlier admissions. Described sabbat near Remiremont 5-6 weeks before with dispute about hailstorm. Confessed to killing neighbor Claudon wife of Mathieu Basle. Accused Claudon widow of Bastien Thiery (la Romaine) as accomplice.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: Retracted accusation against la Romaine, admitted she falsely accused her to speed up procedure.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for question extraordinaire, believing she has not confessed full extent of crimes.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture. Before torture, confessed to fresh series of malefices. Was placed on rack and drawn a little, then confessed to killing 3 men, 2 women, 4 children, crippling 2 men. Renewed accusation against la Romaine and added la Crissatte of Charmes and Catherine Rossel of Floremont.

timeline.subject: Various witnesses
timeline.details: Same day, supposed victims were heard confirming suspicions and harms.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for death sentence.

timeline.subject: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence.

accomplices_named.name: Claudon Pallet
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat near Remiremont 5-6 weeks before. Had dispute with him about causing hailstorm. He wanted to damage crops to sell his own grains better. He kicked her in buttocks.

accomplices_named.name: Claudon widow of Bastien Thiery (la Romaine)
accomplices_named.context: Initially accused of seeing her at sabbat on July 13. Retracted on July 18, admitted false accusation to speed up procedure. Renewed accusation on July 24 under torture.

accomplices_named.name: la Crissatte
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice on July 24 under torture.

accomplices_named.name: Catherine Rossel
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice on July 24 under torture.

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbe femme Jean Mallebarbe
notable_quotes.english: asked to be put to death, but not to feel the fire, as she had harmed no-one
notable_quotes.context: After attempting suicide in prison on July 10, expressing fear of torture

notable_quotes.speaker: wife of Nicolas Meschy (dying words)
notable_quotes.english: la Mallebarbe was the cause of her death
notable_quotes.context: Last words of Nicolas Meschy's wife during her fatal illness

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon wife of Mathieu Basle
notable_quotes.context: Insult directed at Barbe during quarrel, which precipitated her murder according to confession

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (as wind in ear)
notable_quotes.english: a wind had come in her ear telling her she had no power over him
notable_quotes.context: When Barbe wanted to kill Laurent Rouelle but was prevented

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of Claudon Chappelleur and his wife Margueritte
dispute with Laurent Rouelle taillandier of Charmes; he called her witch publicly
killed her neighbour Claudon wife of Mathieu Basle
Mathieu Basle, asked to testify about wife's death
Claudon Marlier said she had given him illness after quarrel when he cut off overhanging branch of apple tree
Claude Hullon's wife confirmed story of cat which had leaped at her throat
she had been suspected not only of causing death of his father
suspected of that of his wife
a sister living at Portessenix had advised her to flee
Had lived at village of Pont near Bonsay, with Claudon la vefue

economic_context.details: Barbe and husband had sold small pieces of land over recent years to support themselves. Now owned only small house in Charmes and garden. Relied on charity and begging. She was too poor to take legal action against Laurent Rouelle for calling her witch. Many of her alleged malefices were triggered by refusals of alms or charity. Economic desperation was central to her situation and many of her conflicts.

called her old witch and accused her of stealing wood from his barn

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: caught her stealing wood and threatened her with punishment
no motive other than master's orders

prior_legal_disputes.outcome: No action taken due to poverty

prior_legal_disputes.description: Caught stealing wood, threatened with punishment, confessed to killing the man who caught her

third_parties.name: Claudon Pallet
third_parties.context: From Rejouville, recently burned at Darney. Seen at sabbat near Remiremont. Wanted to cause hailstorm to damage crops so he could sell his grains better. Kicked Barbe at sabbat.

third_parties.name: Claudon la vefue
third_parties.context: Widow at village of Pont near Bonsay where Barbe stayed during her 4-5 month flight

third_parties.name: Jean Coureur
third_parties.context: Sergent who threatened to put her in prison, causing her to flee

third_parties.name: late prévôt
third_parties.context: Previous prévôt whose 'furie' (fury) Barbe feared, causing her to flee. Had intended to arrest her.

third_parties.name: receveur of Charmes
third_parties.context: Called her an old witch but Devil told her not to avenge herself on him because he often gave her alms

third_parties.name: widow of ox owner
third_parties.context: Confirmed her ox had died strangely and they suspected witchcraft

third_parties.name: bourgeois women at sabbat
third_parties.context: Wore silver belts, arrived on sows or calves, did not eat with others, were masked and unrecognizable

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial record is detailed with clear chronological progression. Confession was obtained under threat of torture and actual torture. Barbe initially confessed voluntarily, then attempted to retract, then confessed more extensively under torture. She attempted suicide in prison. Many of her confessed malefices followed a pattern of economic desperation - refusals of charity triggering revenge. The record shows tension between her claims she harmed no one and extensive confessions to multiple murders and malefices. She retracted one accusation against an accomplice, admitting it was false to speed proceedings. The case demonstrates the role of poverty, reputation, public naming as witch, and the escalation of confessions under interrogation and torture.
